intro: Chesniella villosa, commonly known as the hairy chesniella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
